required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Acceptability of Deferiprone Delayed Release Tablets in Patients With Systemic Iron Overload
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Acceptability of Deferiprone Delayed Release Tablets in Patients With Systemic Iron Overload

brief_summary.textblock: Safety, tolerability, and acceptability of twice-daily dosing with deferiprone delayed-release (DR) tablets in patients with systemic iron overload.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is looking at the safety, tolerability, and acceptability of twice-daily dosing with deferiprone delayed-release (DR) tablets in patients with systemic iron overload who are currently taking deferiprone immediate-release tablets (Ferriprox) three times a day. Ferriprox doses range from 75 milligrams per kilogram of body weight (mg/kg) per day to 100 mg/kg per day. Half the patients in the study will be on a dosage that is closer to the low end of the range, and half will be on a dosage that is closer to the high end. Both groups will be switched for one month to deferiprone DR tablets at approximately the same total daily dosage that they have been taking for Ferriprox.

primary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Patients in Each Treatment Group Who Experience Post-dose Increases in Liver Enzyme Levels That Are Considered a Safety Concern.
primary_outcome.description: Levels of the liver enzymes alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) will be assessed throughout the study to determine if any patients have post-dose increases that are considered to be a safety concern. The criteria for being considered a safety concern are meeting one of the following: For a patient whose level was within the normal range at baseline, the criterion is reaching a value of 5 times the upper limit of normal (ULN) For a patient whose level was above the ULN at baseline, the criterion is reaching either 5 times the baseline value or 10 x ULN

secondary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Patients in Each Treatment Group Who Report Post-dose Occurrences of Gastrointestinal (GI) Distress.
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be asked to report any events of GI distress during the study, such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and dyspepsia.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Patients in Each Group Who Indicate That They Prefer the Deferiprone DR Formulation Over the Immediate-release Formulation.
secondary_outcome.description: At the end of the study, patients will complete a questionnaire to indicate which formulation they prefer.

clinical_study.condition: Iron Overload Due to Repeated Red Blood Cell Transfusions

arm_group.description: Patients in this group will receive a total daily dosage of deferiprone DR tablets that is closer to 75 mg/kg/day. The total dosage will be divided into two equal parts, taken about 12 hours apart.
Patients in this group will receive a total daily dosage of deferiprone DR tablets that is closer to 100 mg/kg/day. The total dosage will be divided into two equal parts, taken about 12 hours apart.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female aged ≥ 18 years.
2. Diagnosis of thalassemia syndrome, sickle cell disease, or other disorder requiring a regular regimen of red blood cell transfusions.
3. On a stable regimen (≥3 months) of Ferriprox tablets for the treatment of systemic iron overload.
4. Absolute neutrophil count ≥1.5 x 10^9/L at screening.
5. A record of at least 12 measured alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) levels.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Receipt of any iron chelator other than Ferriprox (i.e., combination therapy) in the last 3 months, or planning to receive it at any time during the period of the study.
2. ALT and/or AST value > 5 times the upper limit of normal (ULN) at screening
3. Active case of hepatitis B or C at screening.

facility.name: Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago
New York Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center
National and Kapodistrian University of Athens, Aghia Sophia Children's Hospital
San Luigi Gonzaga University Hospital Reparto Microcitemie-Pediatria

group.title: Low Dosage
group.description: Patients in this group will receive a total daily dosage of deferiprone DR tablets that is closer to 75 mg/kg/day. The total dosage will be divided into two equal parts, taken about 12 hours apart. Deferiprone DR tablets 1000 mg (Low dosage): Deferiprone DR tablets 1000 mg

group.title: High Dosage
group.description: Patients in this group will receive a total daily dosage of deferiprone DR tablets that is closer to 100 mg/kg/day. The total dosage will be divided into two equal parts, taken about 12 hours apart. Deferiprone DR tablets 1000 mg (High dosage): Deferiprone DR tablets 1000 mg

baseline.population: One patient in the high-dosage group withdrew before receiving any study product

analysis.groups_desc: One-sample proportion test to determine if the overall preference for deferiprone DR was greater than chance (i.e., a 50% preference for each formulation)
analysis.p_value_desc: A p-value was calculated for the one-sample proportion test.

analysis.groups_desc: One-sample proportion test to determine if the overall preference for deferiprone DR was greater than chance (i.e., a 50% preference for each formulation)
analysis.p_value_desc: A p-value was calculated for the one-sample proportion test.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
